content: clupea cowl by verybusymonkey materials used fingering weight malabrigo sock 440 yards us size 4 needles sport weight malabrigo arroyo 334 yards us size 6 needles aran weight malabrigo worsted 210 yards us size 9 needles other materials needle for weaving in ends stitch marker to note the start of the round gauge each chevron section in parenthesis for round 2 should measure a little over 2 unstretched finished measurements at least 12-13 deep to be able to be folded over length and diameter adjustable to taste pattern notes when reading the pattern the stitch counts should be read as followed fingering weight sport weight aran weight the stitch counts below are for a relatively form-fitting cowl if you prefer a more open-neck cowl you may increase the stitch counts by adding multiples of 18 16 14 stitches note you will also require more yardage as the diameter increases each addition repeat will add a little over 2 to the diameter of the cowl pattern cast on 144 128 112 stitches and work the following two row until you run out of yarn or the cowl is your desired height then repeat row 1 one more time before binding off round 1 k1 p8 7 6 * repeat around round 2 k1 k1fb k5 4 3 ssk k1 k2tog k5 4 3 k1fb * repeat around use the following bind-off for a stretchy bind-off round k1 slip previous stitch over the just worked stitch yo k1 slip yo and previous stitch over the just worked stitch * repeat around until all stitches are bound off copyright© verybusymonkey 2020 1
